name: Bahas, Appellant, v. Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States
name_abbreviation: Bahas v. Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States

judges: Before Kephart, C. J., Schaefer, Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern and Barnes, JJ.
parties: Bahas, Appellant, v. Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The opinion of Judge Parker of the Superior Court conclusively answers all questions involved, and on that opinion the judgment is affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: John E. Evans, Jr., of Margiotti, Pugliese, Evans & Buckley, with Mm Chas. J. Spinelli, for appellant.
Henry Eastman Hackney, with him Seward H. French, Jr., Reed, Smith, Shaw d McClay and Karl W. Warmcastle, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Bahas, Appellant, v. Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States.
Argued March 29, 1938.
Before Kephart, C. J., Schaefer, Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern and Barnes, JJ.
John E. Evans, Jr., of Margiotti, Pugliese, Evans & Buckley, with Mm Chas. J. Spinelli, for appellant.
Henry Eastman Hackney, with him Seward H. French, Jr., Reed, Smith, Shaw d McClay and Karl W. Warmcastle, for appellee.
June 17, 1938:
